results.content: The course was good ,comprehensive and with real world examples. I am going to use the concepts learned and create a great react application.
results.content_html: The course was good ,comprehensive and with real world examples. I am going to use the concepts learned and create a great react application.

results.content:
The course is a very good intro to the basic workflow of ReactJS with a simple "hands on" approach. Very instructive and useful.

A couple of comments:
The GitHub Gists are not easily available and sometimes do not coincide with the code shown in the videos. 
There are features that do not work as shown in the videos too & finally, the scaffolding (yarn, npm) code needs revision.
results.content_html:
The course is a very good intro to the basic workflow of ReactJS with a simple "hands on" approach. Very instructive and useful.

A couple of comments:
The GitHub Gists are not easily available and sometimes do not coincide with the code shown in the videos.
There are features that do not work as shown in the videos too & finally, the scaffolding (yarn, npm) code needs revision.

results.content:
This course was very good and covered the top things I would want to do with React.  (Creating pages, retrieving content from other sites, filtering that content, building user forms, and more).  

I got lost a few times (student error) but was able to find my way pretty quickly because the instructor created an awesome development tool for the students.  Source code for the final project is provided and that helps when trying to debug.
I ran into an issue regarding the gists shared by the Instructor but was able to find my way by looking at the Q&A section. 

I posted a comment regarding my experience looking for the gist and the instructor responded right away saying he would fix it for future students taking the class.
results.content_html:

I ran into an issue regarding the gists shared by the Instructor but was able to find my way by looking at the Q&A section.

results.content: Lots of great things about this course and the kool easy manner that the instructor so knowledgeably handles things. The truth is that its really too seductive to simply watch as he does things. This might be significantly enhanced if he made us do things. I note that Udemy appears to have some instructor functionality that lets the instructor allow us to write code fragments ourselves and have them checked. That would be wonderful ( I think ;-) )

results.content: This course is great to gain an understanding in React, learn the fundamentals while applying it to a working web application. It was well placed and went in-depth. I learnt a lot from this which I can implement in a real world application and hopefully help others understand React

I learnt a lot from this which I can implement in a real world application and hopefully help others understand React

results.content:
Definitely not for users who didn't see react.js before.
It would be good to paste link to sources which are pasted outside of the repository and not to copy letter by letter.
To much advertising about author's other courses without explaining basic functionality of tools used for this project.

results.content:
This course is short, informative and straight to the point. Unlike other courses that I tried, Nelson set up the whole course environment so we don't have to spend hours troubleshooting to make it to the first lecture and concentrate on the React concepts.
Thanks Nelson.
